author: Kristen Lee
title: BREAKING: Fast Car Is Fast
text:
When I first learned of the Bugatti Chiron , the Veyron successor, my immediate thought was that it would probably be a really slow car. Thank God a tweet helped me turn that ass-backwards belief around. Advertisement 
According to Evo road test editor Dan Prosser , the Chiron will allegedly go from zero to 250 MPH and then back down to zero in under a minute. 
That’s, like, really really fast! Who would have thought? 
As Motor1 points out, zero to 250 to zero isn’t a typical test at all, so it’s tough to know how that measures up against everything else. We’ve got stats for a Koenigsegg Agera R , though! Koenigsegg Agera R is officially the king of going then stopping Koenigsegg Agera R is officially the king of going then stopping Koenigsegg Agera R is officially the king of… The Guinness people say it's official — the Koenigsegg Agera R's 0-300-0 km/h (186.4 mph) … Read more Read more 
In 2011, the Agera R ran from 0 to 300 to 0 KPH (186.4 MPH) in just 21.19 seconds. While 186.4 MPH is still a decent ways away from 250 MPH, it’s still a mind-numbing speed. Also, “sub 60 seconds” could mean anything under a minute. Advertisement 
Not too unexpected from a car with 1,478 horsepower. 
Good, I’m glad we were able to clear that up. Pitiful
